chapter: Certain conditions originating in the perinatal period
block: Other disorders originating in the perinatal period
category: Reactions and intoxications due to drugs administered to fetus and newborn
title: Reactions and intoxications due to drugs administered to fetus and newborn
inclusion: conditions that have their origin in the perinatal period even though death or morbidity occurs later
Grey syndrome from chloramphenicol administration in newborn
exclusion: congenital malformations, deformations and chromosomal abnormalities
injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes
jaundice due to drugs or toxins transmitted from mother or given to newborn
reactions and intoxications from maternal opiates, tranquillizers and other medication
withdrawal symptoms from: maternal use of drugs of addiction
withdrawal symptoms from: therapeutic use of drugs in newborn
